text: NGC 7007 is a lenticular galaxy around 130 million light-years away from Earth in the constellation Indus. NGC 7007 was discovered by astronomer John Herschel on July 8, 1834. ==Counter-rotating disk== In NGC 7007, there is counter-rotating disk of ionized gas that counter-rotates with respect to the stars. This indicates an external origin of the gas such as accretion. ==See also== * NGC 7079 * Lenticular galaxy * List of NGC objects (7001–7840) ==References== ==External links== Category:Astronomical objects discovered in 1834 Category:Lenticular galaxies Category:Indus (constellation) 7007 66069
title: NGC 7007
